reviews.review:
Uma direção de arte Incrível!!
Um dos melhores jogos da década !!

Agora que estou zerei novamente o Bioshock: Infinite e digeri o final, gostaria de dar meus dois trocados sobre este joguete. 

Eu sempre tive uma relação muito boa com a série Bioshock. Pra mandar a real é minha segunda série favorita de joguinhos.
Tenho de assumir que a primeira vez que vi os vídeos do Infinite eu estranhei.
O clima mais "superficialmente" alegre me deixava um pouco desgostoso pra ser honesto. 

Erro bobíssimo de minha parte. 
2020 ta ai e finalmente joguei esta belezura.
De início: Eu nunca na minha vida peguei um vínculo emocional tão forte a personagens de jogos quanto com o Booker e a Elizabeth. 

É em um dos pontos que mais me fez gostar deste jogo. Ser acompanhado da garota pela jogatina é uma das coisas mais satisfatórias que já joguei. Me emocionei, chorei, fiquei extremamente irritado. Eu não consigo pensar em um relacionamento que me marcou tanto e que me sinto TÃO ÓRFÃO ao terminar quanto o do Infinite. 

A jogabilidade eu achei bem mais satisfatória que dos anteriores, apesar que o role dos trilhos eu acho um porre. 
Porém, mais uma vez remeto ao fato da Elizabeth acrescentar EM MUITO. Não apenas pela ajuda, mas a companhia em meio ao caos é esplendida.

Quanto a história em si. Prefiro o primeiro ainda, o plot do Andrew Ryan é um dos meus arcos narrativos favoritos de todos os tempos. 
Porém depois de digerir o final do Infinite eu até que gosto dele. Algumas coisas sobre universos são meio de engolir apenas.
Ainda em tempo: Pior parte de todos os bioshock's é aquela da Lady constock... MEUAMIGO.

No final das contas, Infinite entra na vibe de uns dos meus jogos favoritos. Mesmo com o final um pouquinho desgostoso.

Booker e Elizabeth, eu amo vocês.

Infinite is kinda like Marmite to a degree, it's a game you'll either love or hate, so let's start with the setting.

The setting in BioShock Infinite is a nice change of pace from the dark and claustrophobic setting of Rapture in the first two games. Rather than the Art-Deco/Diesel Punk aesthetic from the first two games, Infinite has a Steam Punk aesthetic with the Edwardian-Era fashion and architecture. The levels are more linear than the previous games that works for what the game is, an action-adventure game rather than an immersive sim. The music as usual is fantastic that fits in the setting, but like BioShock 2, the louder music during combat is very common, that could be tiring after a while. There are quiet moments and parts with no combat between story moments and parts in between combat, but there are still more combat overall, more so than BioShock 2.
 
The gunplay on it's own improved upon the previous games alongside the improved sound design for each game improves upon for each weapon. The vigors also works similar to BioShock 2 by allowing you to use both your firearm and powers at the same time. Unlike Plasmids, vigors has a secondary fire mode that allows you to shield yourself or lay out traps, depending on the vigor. As for the mechanics around the gunplay, it's honestly a downgrade, the lack of ammo types removed the counter to bullet sponge enemies. The Vox sandbox also felt unneeded, I felt these weapons would be better suited as alternate firing modes or different ammo types. Overall, the gunplay is very fun while playing around the vigors, despite the downgrade to the mechanics surrounding the gunplay.

The other mechanics like hacking is removed and somewhat replaced with the possession vigor. However, this mechanic somewhat returns in the form of lockpicking in Burial at Sea Episode 2. There are other changes like the Halo two weapon limit, which never bothered me personally, but I do understand why this change is frustrating and limits others. 

The game were streamlined overall to the previous games. I can understand why others were disappointed, as I felt a similar thing with Fallout 4 based on being a fan of the Fallout series for years. As I had no bias to any of the BioShock games and never played any of them prior to 2019, the changes in Infinite doesn't bother me as much, but I do understand why these changes are very frustrating to others.

As for the story, I personally enjoyed it. The characters are mostly memorable, I loved the foreshadowing after replaying the game, I loved seeing how the city collapses throughout the game and the story between Booker and Elizabeth is the strongest part. However, I do have some issues with the pacing during the middle act, the Vox are very underdeveloped and the story is too ambitious in places. 

Enemies are mostly fun to fight like the previous games. Infinite introduces some great enemies like the Firemen, Zealots and Patriots who has their strengths and weaknesses. There are only two enemies I disliked, the Handymen you fight 4 times and the Siren you fight three times. I'll leave it up to you to decide.

In conclusion, Infinite is a game I loved while being open about it's flaws with the gameplay itself and parts of the story, I also typed this earlier, but the review never saved.

LA BELLEZA QUE SE EXTRAÑA

Si echas de menos que un título tenga una historia que conmueva cómo las de hace años, todos los títulos de Bioshock son los indicados. Elizabeth y Booker realmente parecen conectados el uno al otro por un extraño vínculo que querrás proteger. El lugar y sus personajes alrededor de la asombrosa ciudad de Columbia harán que lo bello que es éste juego no te aburra en ningún momento.

Oyun tarihi bir oyun. 2'ci bitirişim. İlk serilerini bitirmediğiniz zaman konusu biraz ağır gelecektir. İster parayla alın ister bedavaya. Bring us the girl and wipe away the debt. Bioshock Infinite grabs you from the very start and never lets go. It's got great graphics, sound, and a story you'll never forget! This game ties into Bioshock 1. So play that first. This is my favorite Bioshock game of the three. I've played through it at least once on each platform it's available on. Every time I've played through it I notice something I didn't before. I highly recommend anyone looking for a great story get this game.

很早买入库的，第一次试玩时，因鲜艳油腻又抖动的蒸汽朋克风，竟然人生第一次玩3D射击玩晕到想吐……但是时隔2年后再玩，一口气用11小时中等难度玩通关。游戏虽然结束，但脑海中仍然想着伊丽莎白的小表情。结局[spoiler]才发现是一个平行世界，原来这是自己的女儿，一切错的根源不要想着去找别人，要勇于承认自己的错并承担最后的后果。对伊丽莎白至始至终都恨不起来，骗她说去巴黎逃跑被抓一路解救，结局让男主接受洗礼重新轮回，游玩时都没有一丝恨意，也许这一切是二十年前种下的因，完成这一切就是让往事记起，折磨与愧疚， [/spoiler]也算是一种救赎吧。

Mind-blowing story ending

Bioshock: Infinite is genuinely one of my favourite games I've ever played when it comes to story. It's full of twists and turns, interesting and likeable characters and with enough mystery to keep you wanting more until the very end, which wraps everything up and leaves no loose ends. The gameplay is great too, with fast-paced action and more movement options than in most FPS games. The voice acting is good, it's visually appealing, and everything just falls into place. Except for one thing:
Replayability. 
Once you're done with the story, that's kind of about it. Sure, the gameplay is still fun, and there are DLC's you can get to expand the experience, but once you've finished Burial at Sea and gotten all the collectibles in Clash in the Clouds (Which is relatively easy), there's not much left to do unless you're going for a 100% achievement run or aiming for top of the leaderboards in Clash in the Clouds.
Overall, is Bioshock: Infinite worth $40.00? Depends what you're looking for. If you're looking for a rich, storytelling experience with some fun and engaging gameplay thrown in, absolutely. If you're looking for a game you can keep coming back to blow some bad guys away, somewhat less so. Maybe when it's on sale, but otherwise, probably not. Overall though, I would definitely recommend this game. It's a hell of an experience, for the first playthrough at least.

Gameplay, story and style. All top notch.

One of my all time favorite games. 

I have beaten it 4 or 5 times now and it still leaves me feeling punched in the gut when the credits roll, but in a good way. I've played this game on Xbox 360, PS4, and PC and it's excellent on any system. 

One issue I did keep running into on the PC version though is an audio crackle that seemed to get louder the longer I played. I do not remember this issue back in 2016 when I played it on PC for the first time. A quick reset of the game would do away with it for a time but then the crackling would come back in another hour or two. 

Overall though I absolutely recommend this game. Easily one of my all time favorite games. Columbia is one of my favorite settings in any series and Booker and Elizabeth are two of my favorite characters, period.
Very good complex emotive story

Игра, которая заставит вас испытать самого себя: испепелить, разорвать, расчленить, раздавить, отправить в бесконечный полет, просто и сокрушительно даст вам понять, что ваш МОЗГ еще не познал себя в этой вселенной! Игра просто ШЕДЕВР, который по мере прохождения заставит ваше сердце биться все чаще и сильнее!
По окончанию игры, у вас будет только один вопрос "Хто Я?" или "Кто Я" ?
Просто купите эту игру, налейте себе виски с колой и парою кубиков льда, звук погромче и насладитесь этой ИГРОЙ сполна!
Запомните, 123 раза выпадет Орел или же 1223 раза, дверей много выбор изменений и разветвления возможно именно в этот раз 124 или 1224.
123 Букера из 122х Комстоков!
이거 안해본 사람 없지?

Это было офигенное путешествие! Сюжет начинается немного вяло, но чем дальше, чем больше деталей раскрываешь, тем становится интереснее. За всю жизнь, я прошёл множество игр, самые разные жанры, вселенные, но сюжет этой игры смог меня удивить, смог задержать, сложно было оторваться. А ведь, чем взрослее становишься, тем сложнее задерживаться в играх, сюжеты слабо цепляют, геймплей надоедает за час игры и всё это очень быстро начинает утомлять. А тут, такое, что на утомление нет совсем времени, ты бежишь в след за героями, за их путешествием, не замечая игровой рутины, именно сюжет + детали держат твоё воображение в поисках новых крупиц, это информативный голод. Весь мир игры продуман до мельчайших деталей, учитывая, что он еще связан с предыдущими играми, честь и хвала авторам. А Элизабет, это самый лучший, самый живой и отличный напарник, под ногами не путается, не тупит, смотреть на неё, слушать, любо-дорого. После прохождения, даже скучаешь по ней.  

Эту игру я купил давно, также давно начинал играть, но на старте забросил. Но вот пришло время этой игры, её бенефис, её 15 минут славы. Я сел и за пару вечеров прошёл на одном дыхании. Как писал ранее, меня сложно удивить шаблонными поворотами сюжета, игры становятся всё более предсказуемыми, как и кинематограф, всё сложнее отыскать именно то, что заставит вас сказать в конце "ВАУ". Когда вам захочется стереть себе память, чтобы вновь вкусить этот шедевральный плод талантливых авторов. Аплодисменты создателям этого чуда! Фантастический ретро утопический шедевр! Если вы не играли, то настоятельно рекомендую. Также прошёл два ДЛС, ну что сказать, всё также прекрасно. Жалко, что Irrational Games закрыли, нынче не хватает, таких креативных игр как Биошок...

Я люблю Биошок. Никак не могу заставить себя пройти старые части (1 и 2, да, 3 игре уже 7 лет), но восхищаюсь их дизайном. Вообще вся серия - пример отличного графического дизайна, нарратива. Но лишь Инфинит я могу назвать примером еще бодрого геймплея. Последний раз я получал удовольствие от синглового шутера именно в Биошок: Инфинит. Да, для кого-то стрельба и в последней части осталась "откровенно топорной", но нельзя не заметить, какая работа в этом плане была проведена со времен второй.

The third and last Bioshock game by its former creators at Irrational Games. Now the game itself: art direction, sound, story, and music are awesome. There aren't many story oriented action games like this anymore as everything is about being always online and multiplayer. However, the reason for not recommending this has to do to the fact that there are bugs that are still in the game that will probably never be rectified because I mean this is 2k and Irrational Games disbanded once this game came out. What bugs? Namely Elizabeth bugging out (disappearing, glitching) and game freezing seemingly out of nowhere. The former happened to me after a checkpoint but somehow it let me continue afterward. Unfortunately in the dlc itself, I am getting constantly frozen out and Elizabeth disappeared twice. So I restarted Burial At Sea 3 times and after that I said fuck it. If you are going to get this game get it dirt cheap < 5 bucks or just pirate it since Irrational isn't there anymore and 2k just doesn't give a shit anyways.
A couple of hours in you realize its friggin Bioshock. Nice storytelling beautiful world even if a bit dated. Nice DLCs for the peeps who played 1 and 2.
